intro: Tabernaemontana simulans, commonly known as the star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its beautiful blooms and pleasant scent. Tabernaemontana simulans prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
